title: Introduction to the survcomp2 Package
Introduction to the survcomp2 Package
text: dataset consist 1598 observations 7 variables. data extracted hospital electronic health records cancer registry. data contain patients’ demographic clinical characteristics treatment information. main variable interest Groups, encompasses 5 subgroups breast cancer patients; : Luminal (0), Luminal B (1), Triple Negative (2), Her2 Enriched (3), Triple Positive (4). Another variable interest Breast_surgery_code two levels: segmental mastectomy (0) simple mastectomy (1). easier model interpretation, note codes parentheses correspond levels showed analysis outputs , different coding used data.

title: Introduction to the survcomp2 Package
text: overall survival different among subgroups breast cancer survivors within level surgery types, .e., segmental (0) vs simple mastectomy (1)? , overall survival differ subgroups breast cancer survivors within level surgery types?

title: Introduction to the survcomp2 Package
text: plan first plot Kaplan-Meier survival curves stratified subgroups patients within level surgery types, perform global log-rank tests see least one subgroup patients whose overall survival different others. enough evidence reject null hypothesis global log-rank test; , difference overall survival among subgroups breast cancer survivors, can perform post-hoc pairwise comparisons within level surgery types adjusting multiplicity find pair subgroups different.

title: Introduction to the survcomp2 Package
text: enough evidence reject null hypothesis global log-rank test. shall proceed.
code: survcomp_plot(dat = dat_da, patid = "ID..",                f1 = "Groups", f2 = "Breast_surgery_code",               dt_start = "DT_dxdate2",               dt_outcome = "DT_dod",                dt_end = "DT_date_last_seen") emm_contrasts <- survcomp(dat = dat_da, patid = "ID..",                           x_c = c("Groups", "Breast_surgery_code"),                           x_n = "AGE_agedx", dt_start = "DT_dxdate2",                           dt_outcome = "DT_dod",                           dt_end = "DT_date_last_seen")

title: Introduction to the survcomp2 Package
text: undergone segmental mastectomy, statistically discernible difference overall survival Luminal Triple Negative cohorts. undergone simple mastectomy, statistically discernible differences overall survival Luminal Triple Negative cohorts, Triple Negative Triple Postive cohorts.
code: emm_contrasts[emm_contrasts$p.value < 0.05, ] #>  contrast          Breast_surgery_code ratio     SE  df asymp.LCL asymp.UCL #>  Groups0 / Groups2 0                   0.435 0.0918 Inf     0.245     0.774 #>  Groups0 / Groups2 1                   0.430 0.0945 Inf     0.236     0.783 #>  Groups2 / Groups4 1                   4.364 2.2824 Inf     1.048    18.175 #>  null z.ratio p.value #>     1  -3.944  0.0008 #>     1  -3.838  0.0012 #>     1   2.817  0.0390 #>  #> Confidence level used: 0.95  #> Conf-level adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 5 estimates  #> Intervals are back-transformed from the log scale  #> P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 5 estimates  #> Tests are performed on the log scale pwcomp_output_df <- data.frame(   contrast = emm_contrasts$contrast,   factor2 = emm_contrasts$Breast_surgery_code,   hazard_ratio = round(emm_contrasts$ratio, 3),   standard_error = round(emm_contrasts$SE, 3),   dof = emm_contrasts$df,   #lower_limit = emm_contrasts$asymp.LCL,   #upper_limit = emm_contrasts$asymp.UCL,   #null_hyp = emm_contrasts$null,   #test_stat = emm_contrasts$z.ratio,   p = round(emm_contrasts$p.value, 3) ) pwcomp_output_df #>             contrast factor2 hazard_ratio standard_error dof     p #> 1  Groups0 / Groups1       0        0.539          0.126 Inf 0.062 #> 2  Groups0 / Groups2       0 Groups0 / Groups1       1        0.541          0.136 Inf 0.105 #> 12 Groups0 / Groups2       1        0.430          0.095 Inf 0.001 #> 13 Groups0 / Groups3       1        0.824          0.319 Inf text: Contains grouping variable, essential information needed derive overall survival time status breast cancer survivor.

title: Data to showcase differences in overall survival among subgroups of breast cancer survivors — dat_da
Data to showcase differences in overall survival among subgroups of breast cancer survivors — dat_da
text: data frame 1598 rows 7 variables ID.. Subject ID Groups 5 groups breast cancer Breast_surgery_code Surgery type AGE_agedx Age cancer diagnosis DT_dxdate2 Date cancer diagnosis DT_dod Date death DT_date_last_seen Date last follow-

title: Data to showcase differences in overall survival among subgroups of breast cancer survivors — dat_da

what: Post-hoc Within Group Comparisons of Differences in a Survival Outcome — survcomp
title: Post-hoc Within Group Comparisons of Differences in a Survival Outcome — survcomp
text: Performs pairwise comparisons levels one categorical variable within level another categorical variable adjusting multiplicity.

title: Post-hoc Within Group Comparisons of Differences in a Survival Outcome — survcomp
code: survcomp(dat, patid, x_c, x_n, dt_start, dt_outcome, dt_end, unit = "month")

title: Post-hoc Within Group Comparisons of Differences in a Survival Outcome — survcomp
text: dat data frame. patid integer vector subject IDs. x_c name(s) categorical variable(s). x_n name(s) numeric variable(s). dt_start name date starting point. dt_outcome name date survival outcome. dt_end name date endpoint. unit unit measurement time variable; options : "day", "month", "year".

title: Post-hoc Within Group Comparisons of Differences in a Survival Outcome — survcomp
text: summary_emm object data frame pairwise comparisons, confidence intervals, test statistics, p-values.

title: Post-hoc Within Group Comparisons of Differences in a Survival Outcome — survcomp
code: # Read in the sample data data(dat_da) emm_contrasts <- survcomp( dat = dat_da, patid = "ID..", x_c = c("Groups", "Breast_surgery_code"), x_n = "AGE_agedx", dt_start = "DT_dxdate2", dt_outcome = "DT_dod", dt_end = "DT_date_last_seen" ) # Only keep the statistically significant pairwise comparisons emm_contrasts[emm_contrasts$p.value < 0.05, ] #>  contrast          Breast_surgery_code ratio     SE  df asymp.LCL asymp.UCL #>  Groups0 / Groups2 0                   0.435 0.0918 Inf     0.245     0.774 #>  Groups0 / Groups2 1                   0.430 0.0945 Inf     0.236     0.783 #>  Groups2 / Groups4 1                   4.364 2.2824 Inf     1.048    18.175 #>  null z.ratio p.value #>     1  -3.944  0.0008 #>     1  -3.838  0.0012 #>     1   2.817  0.0390 #>  #> Confidence level used: 0.95  #> Conf-level adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 5 estimates  #> Intervals are back-transformed from the log scale  #> P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 5 estimates  #> Tests are performed on the log scale

what: Kapan-Meier Plots and Log-rank Test — survcomp_plot
title: Kapan-Meier Plots and Log-rank Test — survcomp_plot
text: Draws Kaplan-Meier plots survival outcome interest, compares levels one categorical variable within level another categorical variable globally via log-rank tests.

title: Kapan-Meier Plots and Log-rank Test — survcomp_plot
code: survcomp_plot(dat, patid, f1, f2, dt_start, dt_outcome, dt_end, unit = "month")

title: Kapan-Meier Plots and Log-rank Test — survcomp_plot
text: dat data frame. patid integer vector subject IDs. f1 name first categorical variable. f2 name second categorical variable. dt_start name date starting point. dt_outcome name date survival outcome. dt_end name date endpoint. unit unit measurement time variable; options : "day", "month", "year".

title: Kapan-Meier Plots and Log-rank Test — survcomp_plot
text: Multiple Kaplan-Meier plots display p-values log-rank tests.

title: Kapan-Meier Plots and Log-rank Test — survcomp_plot
code: # Read in the sample data data(dat_da) sample_surv_curves <- survcomp_plot( dat = dat_da, patid = "ID..", f1 = "Groups", f2 = "Breast_surgery_code", dt_start = "DT_dxdate2", dt_outcome = "DT_dod", dt_end = "DT_date_last_seen" )
